4219
4220#ifndef SIM
4221static void
4222config_unpeers(
4223 config_tree *ptree
4224 )
4225{
4226 sockaddr_u peeraddr;
4227 struct addrinfo hints;
4228 unpeer_node * curr_unpeer;
4229 struct peer * p;
4230 const char * name;
4231 int rc;
4232
4233 curr_unpeer = HEAD_PFIFO(ptree->unpeers);
4234 for (; curr_unpeer != NULL; curr_unpeer = curr_unpeer->link) {
4235 /*
4236 * If we have no address attached, assume we have to
4237 * unpeer by AssocID.
4238 */
4239 if (!curr_unpeer->addr) {
4240 p = findpeerbyassoc(curr_unpeer->assocID);
4241 if (p != NULL) {
4242 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE, "unpeered %s",
4243 stoa(&p->srcadr));
4244 peer_clear(p, "GONE");
4245 unpeer(p);
4246 }
4247 continue;
4248 }
4249
4250 ZERO(peeraddr);
4251 AF(&peeraddr) = curr_unpeer->addr->type;
4252 name = curr_unpeer->addr->address;
4253 rc = getnetnum(name, &peeraddr, 0, t_UNK);
4254 /* Do we have a numeric address? */
4255 if (rc > 0) {
4256 DPRINTF(1, ("unpeer: searching for %s\n",
4257 stoa(&peeraddr)));
4258 p = findexistingpeer(&peeraddr, NULL, NULL, -1, 0, NULL);
4259 if (p != NULL) {
4260 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE, "unpeered %s",
4261 stoa(&peeraddr));
4262 peer_clear(p, "GONE");
4263 unpeer(p);
4264 }
4265 continue;
4266 }
4267 /*
4268 * It's not a numeric IP address, it's a hostname.
4269 * Check for associations with a matching hostname.
4270 */
4271 for (p = peer_list; p != NULL; p = p->p_link)
4272 if (p->hostname != NULL)
4273 if (!strcasecmp(p->hostname, name))
4274 break;
4275 if (p != NULL) {
4276 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE, "unpeered %s", name);
4277 peer_clear(p, "GONE");
4278 unpeer(p);
4279 }
4280 /* Resolve the hostname to address(es). */
4281# ifdef WORKER
4282 ZERO(hints);
4283 hints.ai_family = curr_unpeer->addr->type;
4284 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
4285 hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_UDP;
4286 getaddrinfo_sometime(name, "ntp", &hints,
4287 INITIAL_DNS_RETRY,
4288 &unpeer_name_resolved, NULL);
4289# else /* !WORKER follows */
4290 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
4291 "hostname %s can not be used, please use IP address instead.",
4292 name);
4293# endif
4294 }
4295}
4296#endif /* !SIM */
4297
4298
4299/*
4300 * unpeer_name_resolved()
4301 *
4302 * Callback invoked when config_unpeers()'s DNS lookup completes.
4303 */
4304#ifdef WORKER
4305static void
4306unpeer_name_resolved(
4307 int rescode,
4308 int gai_errno,
4309 void * context,
4310 const char * name,
4311 const char * service,
4312 const struct addrinfo * hints,
4313 const struct addrinfo * res
4314 )
4315{
4316 sockaddr_u peeraddr;
4317 struct peer * peer;
4318 u_short af;
4319 const char * fam_spec;
4320
4321 (void)context;
4322 (void)hints;
4323 DPRINTF(1, ("unpeer_name_resolved(%s) rescode %d\n", name, rescode));
4324
4325 if (rescode) {
4326 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "giving up resolving unpeer %s: %s (%d)",
4327 name, gai_strerror(rescode), rescode);
4328 return;
4329 }
4330 /*
4331 * Loop through the addresses found
4332 */
4333 for (; res != NULL; res = res->ai_next) {
4334 INSIST(res->ai_addrlen <= sizeof(peeraddr));
4335 memcpy(&peeraddr, res->ai_addr, res->ai_addrlen);
4336 DPRINTF(1, ("unpeer: searching for peer %s\n",
4337 stoa(&peeraddr)));
4338 peer = findexistingpeer(&peeraddr, NULL, NULL, -1, 0, NULL);
4339 if (peer != NULL) {
4340 af = AF(&peeraddr);
4341 fam_spec = (AF_INET6 == af)
4342 ? "(AAAA) "
4343 : (AF_INET == af)
4344 ? "(A) "
4345 : "";
4346 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE, "unpeered %s %s-> %s", name,
4347 fam_spec, stoa(&peeraddr));
4348 peer_clear(peer, "GONE");
4349 unpeer(peer);
4350 }
4351 }
4352}
4353#endif /* WORKER */

4380config_reset_counters(
4381 config_tree *ptree
4382 )

4385

4388 counter_set = counter_set->link) {
4389 switch (counter_set->i) {
4390 default:
4391 DPRINTF(1, ("config_reset_counters %s (%d) invalid\n",
4392 keyword(counter_set->i), counter_set->i));
4393 break;
4394
4395 case T_Allpeers:
4396 peer_all_reset();
4397 break;
4398
4399 case T_Auth:
4400 reset_auth_stats();
4401 break;
4402
4403 case T_Ctl:
4404 ctl_clr_stats();
4405 break;
4406
4407 case T_Io:
4408 io_clr_stats();
4409 break;
4410
4411 case T_Mem:
4412 peer_clr_stats();
4413 break;
4414
4415 case T_Sys:
4416 proto_clr_stats();
4417 break;
4418
4419 case T_Timer:

4421 break;
4422 }

4439#ifdef SIM
4440static void
4441config_sim(
4442 config_tree *ptree
4443 )
4444{
4445 int i;
4446 server_info *serv_info;
4447 attr_val *init_stmt;
4448 sim_node *sim_n;
4449
4450 /* Check if a simulate block was found in the configuration code.
4451 * If not, return an error and exit
4452 */
4453 sim_n = HEAD_PFIFO(ptree->sim_details);
4454 if (NULL == sim_n) {
4455 fprintf(stderr, "ERROR!! I couldn't find a \"simulate\" block for configuring the simulator.\n");
4456 fprintf(stderr, "\tCheck your configuration file.\n");
4457 exit(1);
4458 }
4459
4460 /* Process the initialization statements
4461 * -------------------------------------
4462 */
4463 init_stmt = HEAD_PFIFO(sim_n->init_opts);
4464 for (; init_stmt != NULL; init_stmt = init_stmt->link) {
4465 switch(init_stmt->attr) {
4466
4467 case T_Beep_Delay:
4468 simulation.beep_delay = init_stmt->value.d;
4469 break;
4470
4471 case T_Sim_Duration:
4472 simulation.end_time = init_stmt->value.d;
4473 break;
4474
4475 default:
4476 fprintf(stderr,
4477 "Unknown simulator init token %d\n",
4478 init_stmt->attr);
4479 exit(1);
4480 }
4481 }
4482
4483 /* Process the server list
4484 * -----------------------
4485 */
4486 simulation.num_of_servers = 0;
4487 serv_info = HEAD_PFIFO(sim_n->servers);
4488 for (; serv_info != NULL; serv_info = serv_info->link)
4489 simulation.num_of_servers++;
4490 simulation.servers = eallocarray(simulation.num_of_servers,
4491 sizeof(simulation.servers[0]));
4492
4493 i = 0;
4494 serv_info = HEAD_PFIFO(sim_n->servers);
4495 for (; serv_info != NULL; serv_info = serv_info->link) {
4496 if (NULL == serv_info) {
4497 fprintf(stderr, "Simulator server list is corrupt\n");
4498 exit(1);
4499 } else {
4500 simulation.servers[i] = *serv_info;
4501 simulation.servers[i].link = NULL;
4502 i++;
4503 }
4504 }
4505
4506 printf("Creating server associations\n");
4507 create_server_associations();
4508 fprintf(stderr,"\tServer associations successfully created!!\n");
4509}
4510
4511
4512#ifdef FREE_CFG_T
4513static void
4514free_config_sim(
4515 config_tree *ptree
4516 )
4517{
4518 sim_node *sim_n;
4519 server_info *serv_n;
4520 script_info *script_n;
4521
4522 if (NULL == ptree->sim_details)
4523 return;
4524 sim_n = HEAD_PFIFO(ptree->sim_details);
4525 free(ptree->sim_details);
4526 ptree->sim_details = NULL;
4527 if (NULL == sim_n)
4528 return;
4529
4530 FREE_ATTR_VAL_FIFO(sim_n->init_opts);
4531 for (;;) {
4532 UNLINK_FIFO(serv_n, *sim_n->servers, link);
4533 if (NULL == serv_n)
4534 break;
4535 free(serv_n->curr_script);
4536 if (serv_n->script != NULL) {
4537 for (;;) {
4538 UNLINK_FIFO(script_n, *serv_n->script,
4539 link);
4540 if (script_n == NULL)
4541 break;
4542 free(script_n);
4543 }
4544 free(serv_n->script);
4545 }
4546 free(serv_n);
4547 }
4548 free(sim_n);
4549}
4550#endif /* FREE_CFG_T */
4551#endif /* SIM */

4563 )
4564{

4567 * this ASAP, so we don't disturb the closed loop controller.
4568 */

4571 clamp_systime();
4572 }
4573
4574 config_nic_rules(ptree, input_from_files);
4575 config_monitor(ptree);

4585 config_setvar(ptree);

4587 config_vars(ptree);
4588
4589 io_open_sockets(); /* [bug 2837] dep. on config_vars() */
4590
4591 config_trap(ptree); /* [bug 2923] dep. on io_open_sockets() */
4592 config_other_modes(ptree);
4593 config_peers(ptree);
4594 config_unpeers(ptree);
4595 config_fudge(ptree);
4596 config_reset_counters(ptree);
4597
4598#ifdef DEBUG
4599 if (debug > 1) {
4600 dump_restricts();
4601 }
4602#endif
4603
4604#ifdef TEST_BLOCKING_WORKER
4605 {
4606 struct addrinfo hints;
4607
4608 ZERO(hints);
4609 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
4610 hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_TCP;
4611 getaddrinfo_sometime("www.cnn.com", "ntp", &hints,
4612 INITIAL_DNS_RETRY,
4613 gai_test_callback, (void *)1);
4614 hints.ai_family = AF_INET6;
4615 getaddrinfo_sometime("ipv6.google.com", "ntp", &hints,
4616 INITIAL_DNS_RETRY,
4617 gai_test_callback, (void *)0x600);
4618 }

4646/*
4647 * config_remotely() - implements ntpd side of ntpq :config
4648 */
4649void
4650config_remotely(
4651 sockaddr_u * remote_addr
4652 )
4653{
4654 char origin[128];
4655
4656 snprintf(origin, sizeof(origin), "remote config from %s",
4657 stoa(remote_addr));
4658 lex_init_stack(origin, NULL); /* no checking needed... */
4659 init_syntax_tree(&cfgt);
4660 yyparse();
4661 lex_drop_stack();
4662
4663 cfgt.source.attr = CONF_SOURCE_NTPQ;
4664 cfgt.timestamp = time(NULL);
4665 cfgt.source.value.s = estrdup(stoa(remote_addr));
4666
4667 DPRINTF(1, ("Finished Parsing!!\n"));
4668
4669 save_and_apply_config_tree(FALSE);
4670}

4672
4673/*
4674 * getconfig() - process startup configuration file e.g /etc/ntp.conf
4675 */
4676void
4677getconfig(
4678 int argc,
4679 char ** argv
4680 )
4681{
4682 char line[256];
4683
4684#ifdef DEBUG
4685 atexit(free_all_config_trees);
4686#endif
4687#ifndef SYS_WINNT
4688 config_file = CONFIG_FILE;
4689#else
4690 temp = CONFIG_FILE;
4691 if (!ExpandEnvironmentStringsA(temp, config_file_storage,
4692 sizeof(config_file_storage))) {
4693 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "ExpandEnvironmentStrings CONFIG_FILE failed: %m");
4694 exit(1);
4695 }
4696 config_file = config_file_storage;
4697
4698 temp = ALT_CONFIG_FILE;
4699 if (!ExpandEnvironmentStringsA(temp, alt_config_file_storage,
4700 sizeof(alt_config_file_storage))) {
4701 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "ExpandEnvironmentStrings ALT_CONFIG_FILE failed: %m");
4702 exit(1);
4703 }
4704 alt_config_file = alt_config_file_storage;
4705#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
4706
4707 /*
4708 * install a non default variable with this daemon version
4709 */
4710 snprintf(line, sizeof(line), "daemon_version=\"%s\"", Version);
4711 set_sys_var(line, strlen(line) + 1, RO);
4712
4713 /*
4714 * Set up for the first time step to install a variable showing
4715 * which syscall is being used to step.
4716 */
4717 set_tod_using = &ntpd_set_tod_using;
4718
4719 getCmdOpts(argc, argv);
4720 init_syntax_tree(&cfgt);
4721 if (
4722 !lex_init_stack(FindConfig(config_file), "r")
4723#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
4724 /* If there is no config_file, try NetInfo. */
4725 && check_netinfo && !(config_netinfo = get_netinfo_config())
4726#endif /* HAVE_NETINFO */
4727 ) {
4728 msyslog(LOG_INFO, "getconfig: Couldn't open <%s>: %m", FindConfig(config_file));
4729#ifndef SYS_WINNT
4730 io_open_sockets();
4731
4732 return;
4733#else
4734 /* Under WinNT try alternate_config_file name, first NTP.CONF, then NTP.INI */
4735
4736 if (!lex_init_stack(FindConfig(alt_config_file), "r")) {
4737 /*
4738 * Broadcast clients can sometimes run without
4739 * a configuration file.
4740 */
4741 msyslog(LOG_INFO, "getconfig: Couldn't open <%s>: %m", FindConfig(alt_config_file));
4742 io_open_sockets();
4743
4744 return;
4745 }
4746 cfgt.source.value.s = estrdup(alt_config_file);
4747#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
4748 } else
4749 cfgt.source.value.s = estrdup(config_file);
4750
4751
4752 /*** BULK OF THE PARSER ***/
4753#if defined(DEBUG) && defined(YYDEBUG)
4754 yydebug = !!(debug >= 5);
4755#endif
4756 yyparse();
4757 lex_drop_stack();
4758
4759 DPRINTF(1, ("Finished Parsing!!\n"));
4760
4761 cfgt.source.attr = CONF_SOURCE_FILE;
4762 cfgt.timestamp = time(NULL);
4763
4764 save_and_apply_config_tree(TRUE);
4765
4766#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
4767 if (config_netinfo)
4768 free_netinfo_config(config_netinfo);
4769#endif /* HAVE_NETINFO */
4770}
4771
4772
4773void
4774save_and_apply_config_tree(int/*BOOL*/ input_from_file)
4775{
4776 config_tree *ptree;
4777#ifndef SAVECONFIG
4778 config_tree *punlinked;
4779#endif
4780
4781 /*
4782 * Keep all the configuration trees applied since startup in
4783 * a list that can be used to dump the configuration back to
4784 * a text file.
4785 */
4786 ptree = emalloc(sizeof(*ptree));
4787 memcpy(ptree, &cfgt, sizeof(*ptree));
4788 ZERO(cfgt);
4789
4790 LINK_TAIL_SLIST(cfg_tree_history, ptree, link, config_tree);
4791
4792#ifdef SAVECONFIG
4793 if (HAVE_OPT( SAVECONFIGQUIT )) {
4794 FILE *dumpfile;
4795 int err;
4796 int dumpfailed;
4797
4798 dumpfile = fopen(OPT_ARG( SAVECONFIGQUIT ), "w");
4799 if (NULL == dumpfile) {
4800 err = errno;
4801 mfprintf(stderr,
4802 "can not create save file %s, error %d %m\n",
4803 OPT_ARG(SAVECONFIGQUIT), err);
4804 exit(err);
4805 }
4806
4807 dumpfailed = dump_all_config_trees(dumpfile, 0);
4808 if (dumpfailed)
4809 fprintf(stderr,
4810 "--saveconfigquit %s error %d\n",
4811 OPT_ARG( SAVECONFIGQUIT ),
4812 dumpfailed);
4813 else
4814 fprintf(stderr,
4815 "configuration saved to %s\n",
4816 OPT_ARG( SAVECONFIGQUIT ));
4817
4818 exit(dumpfailed);
4819 }
4820#endif /* SAVECONFIG */
4821
4822 /* The actual configuration done depends on whether we are configuring the
4823 * simulator or the daemon. Perform a check and call the appropriate
4824 * function as needed.
4825 */
4826
4827#ifndef SIM
4828 config_ntpd(ptree, input_from_file);
4829#else
4830 config_ntpdsim(ptree);
4831#endif
4832
4833 /*
4834 * With configure --disable-saveconfig, there's no use keeping
4835 * the config tree around after application, so free it.
4836 */
4837#ifndef SAVECONFIG
4838 UNLINK_SLIST(punlinked, cfg_tree_history, ptree, link,
4839 config_tree);
4840 INSIST(punlinked == ptree);
4841 free_config_tree(ptree);
4842#endif
4843}

4845/* Hack to disambiguate 'server' statements for refclocks and network peers.
4846 * Please note the qualification 'hack'. It's just that.
4847 */
4848static int/*BOOL*/
4849is_refclk_addr(
4850 const address_node * addr
4851 )
4852{
4853 return addr && addr->address && !strncmp(addr->address, "127.127.", 8);
4854}
4855
4856static void
4857ntpd_set_tod_using(
4858 const char *which
4859 )
4860{
4861 char line[128];
4862
4863 snprintf(line, sizeof(line), "settimeofday=\"%s\"", which);
4864 set_sys_var(line, strlen(line) + 1, RO);
4865}
4866
4867
4868static char *
4869normal_dtoa(
4870 double d
4871 )
4872{
4873 char * buf;
4874 char * pch_e;
4875 char * pch_nz;
4876
4877 LIB_GETBUF(buf);
4878 snprintf(buf, LIB_BUFLENGTH, "%g", d);
4879
4880 /* use lowercase 'e', strip any leading zeroes in exponent */
4881 pch_e = strchr(buf, 'e');
4882 if (NULL == pch_e) {
4883 pch_e = strchr(buf, 'E');
4884 if (NULL == pch_e)
4885 return buf;
4886 *pch_e = 'e';
4887 }
4888 pch_e++;
4889 if ('-' == *pch_e)
4890 pch_e++;
4891 pch_nz = pch_e;
4892 while ('0' == *pch_nz)
4893 pch_nz++;
4894 if (pch_nz == pch_e)
4895 return buf;
4896 strlcpy(pch_e, pch_nz, LIB_BUFLENGTH - (pch_e - buf));
4897
4898 return buf;
4899}

4906
4907/*
4908 * get_pfxmatch - find value for prefixmatch
4909 * and update char * accordingly
4910 */
4911static u_int32
4912get_pfxmatch(
4913 const char ** pstr,
4914 struct masks * m
4915 )
4916{
4917 while (m->name != NULL) {
4918 if (strncmp(*pstr, m->name, strlen(m->name)) == 0) {
4919 *pstr += strlen(m->name);
4920 return m->mask;
4921 } else {
4922 m++;
4923 }
4924 }
4925 return 0;
4926}
4927
4928/*
4929 * get_match - find logmask value
4930 */
4931static u_int32
4932get_match(
4933 const char * str,
4934 struct masks * m
4935 )
4936{
4937 while (m->name != NULL) {
4938 if (strcmp(str, m->name) == 0)
4939 return m->mask;
4940 else
4941 m++;
4942 }
4943 return 0;
4944}
4945
4946/*
4947 * get_logmask - build bitmask for ntp_syslogmask
4948 */
4949static u_int32
4950get_logmask(
4951 const char * str
4952 )
4953{
4954 const char * t;
4955 u_int32 offset;
4956 u_int32 mask;
4957
4958 mask = get_match(str, logcfg_noclass_items);
4959 if (mask != 0)
4960 return mask;
4961
4962 t = str;
4963 offset = get_pfxmatch(&t, logcfg_class);
4964 mask = get_match(t, logcfg_class_items);
4965
4966 if (mask)
4967 return mask << offset;
4968 else
4969 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "logconfig: '%s' not recognized - ignored",
4970 str);
4971
4972 return 0;
4973}

4976#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
4977
4978/*
4979 * get_netinfo_config - find the nearest NetInfo domain with an ntp
4980 * configuration and initialize the configuration state.
4981 */
4982static struct netinfo_config_state *
4983get_netinfo_config(void)
4984{
4985 ni_status status;
4986 void *domain;
4987 ni_id config_dir;
4988 struct netinfo_config_state *config;
4989
4990 if (ni_open(NULL, ".", &domain) != NI_OK) return NULL;
4991
4992 while ((status = ni_pathsearch(domain, &config_dir, NETINFO_CONFIG_DIR)) == NI_NODIR) {
4993 void *next_domain;
4994 if (ni_open(domain, "..", &next_domain) != NI_OK) {
4995 ni_free(next_domain);
4996 break;
4997 }
4998 ni_free(domain);
4999 domain = next_domain;
5000 }
5001 if (status != NI_OK) {
5002 ni_free(domain);
5003 return NULL;
5004 }
5005
5006 config = emalloc(sizeof(*config));
5007 config->domain = domain;
5008 config->config_dir = config_dir;
5009 config->prop_index = 0;
5010 config->val_index = 0;
5011 config->val_list = NULL;
5012
5013 return config;
5014}
5015
5016
5017/*
5018 * free_netinfo_config - release NetInfo configuration state
5019 */
5020static void
5021free_netinfo_config(
5022 struct netinfo_config_state *config
5023 )
5024{
5025 ni_free(config->domain);
5026 free(config);
5027}
5028
5029
5030/*
5031 * gettokens_netinfo - return tokens from NetInfo
5032 */
5033static int
5034gettokens_netinfo (
5035 struct netinfo_config_state *config,
5036 char **tokenlist,
5037 int *ntokens
5038 )
5039{
5040 int prop_index = config->prop_index;
5041 int val_index = config->val_index;
5042 char **val_list = config->val_list;
5043
5044 /*
5045 * Iterate through each keyword and look for a property that matches it.
5046 */
5047 again:
5048 if (!val_list) {
5049 for (; prop_index < COUNTOF(keywords); prop_index++)
5050 {
5051 ni_namelist namelist;
5052 struct keyword current_prop = keywords[prop_index];
5053 ni_index index;
5054
5055 /*
5056 * For each value associated in the property, we're going to return
5057 * a separate line. We squirrel away the values in the config state
5058 * so the next time through, we don't need to do this lookup.
5059 */
5060 NI_INIT(&namelist);
5061 if (NI_OK == ni_lookupprop(config->domain,
5062 &config->config_dir, current_prop.text,
5063 &namelist)) {
5064
5065 /* Found the property, but it has no values */
5066 if (namelist.ni_namelist_len == 0) continue;
5067
5068 config->val_list =
5069 eallocarray(
5070 (namelist.ni_namelist_len + 1),
5071 sizeof(char*));
5072 val_list = config->val_list;
5073
5074 for (index = 0;
5075 index < namelist.ni_namelist_len;
5076 index++) {
5077 char *value;
5078
5079 value = namelist.ni_namelist_val[index];
5080 val_list[index] = estrdup(value);
5081 }
5082 val_list[index] = NULL;
5083
5084 break;
5085 }
5086 ni_namelist_free(&namelist);
5087 }
5088 config->prop_index = prop_index;
5089 }
5090
5091 /* No list; we're done here. */
5092 if (!val_list)
5093 return CONFIG_UNKNOWN;
5094
5095 /*
5096 * We have a list of values for the current property.
5097 * Iterate through them and return each in order.
5098 */
5099 if (val_list[val_index]) {
5100 int ntok = 1;
5101 int quoted = 0;
5102 char *tokens = val_list[val_index];
5103
5104 msyslog(LOG_INFO, "%s %s", keywords[prop_index].text, val_list[val_index]);
5105
5106 (const char*)tokenlist[0] = keywords[prop_index].text;
5107 for (ntok = 1; ntok < MAXTOKENS; ntok++) {
5108 tokenlist[ntok] = tokens;
5109 while (!ISEOL(*tokens) && (!ISSPACE(*tokens) || quoted))
5110 quoted ^= (*tokens++ == '"');
5111
5112 if (ISEOL(*tokens)) {
5113 *tokens = '\0';
5114 break;
5115 } else { /* must be space */
5116 *tokens++ = '\0';
5117 while (ISSPACE(*tokens))
5118 tokens++;
5119 if (ISEOL(*tokens))
5120 break;
5121 }
5122 }
5123
5124 if (ntok == MAXTOKENS) {
5125 /* HMS: chomp it to lose the EOL? */
5126 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
5127 "gettokens_netinfo: too many tokens. Ignoring: %s",
5128 tokens);
5129 } else {
5130 *ntokens = ntok + 1;
5131 }
5132
5133 config->val_index++; /* HMS: Should this be in the 'else'? */
5134
5135 return keywords[prop_index].keytype;
5136 }
5137
5138 /* We're done with the current property. */
5139 prop_index = ++config->prop_index;
5140
5141 /* Free val_list and reset counters. */
5142 for (val_index = 0; val_list[val_index]; val_index++)
5143 free(val_list[val_index]);
5144 free(val_list);
5145 val_list = config->val_list = NULL;
5146 val_index = config->val_index = 0;
5147
5148 goto again;
5149}
5150#endif /* HAVE_NETINFO */
5151
5152
5153/*
5154 * getnetnum - return a net number (this is crude, but careful)
5155 *
5156 * returns 1 for success, and mysteriously, 0 for most failures, and
5157 * -1 if the address found is IPv6 and we believe IPv6 isn't working.
5158 */
5159#ifndef SIM
5160static int
5161getnetnum(
5162 const char *num,
5163 sockaddr_u *addr,
5164 int complain,
5165 enum gnn_type a_type /* ignored */
5166 )
5167{
5168 REQUIRE(AF_UNSPEC == AF(addr) ||
5169 AF_INET == AF(addr) ||
5170 AF_INET6 == AF(addr));
5171
5172 if (!is_ip_address(num, AF(addr), addr))
5173 return 0;
5174
5175 if (IS_IPV6(addr) && !ipv6_works)
5176 return -1;
5177
5178# ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_HAVESALEN
5179 addr->sa.sa_len = SIZEOF_SOCKADDR(AF(addr));
5180# endif
5181 SET_PORT(addr, NTP_PORT);
5182
5183 DPRINTF(2, ("getnetnum given %s, got %s\n", num, stoa(addr)));
5184
5185 return 1;
5186}
5187#endif /* !SIM */
5188
5189#if defined(HAVE_SETRLIMIT)
5190void
5191ntp_rlimit(
5192 int rl_what,
5193 rlim_t rl_value,
5194 int rl_scale,
5195 const char * rl_sstr
5196 )
5197{
5198 struct rlimit rl;
5199
5200 switch (rl_what) {
5201# ifdef RLIMIT_MEMLOCK
5202 case RLIMIT_MEMLOCK:
5203 if (HAVE_OPT( SAVECONFIGQUIT )) {
5204 break;
5205 }
5206 /*
5207 * The default RLIMIT_MEMLOCK is very low on Linux systems.
5208 * Unless we increase this limit malloc calls are likely to
5209 * fail if we drop root privilege. To be useful the value
5210 * has to be larger than the largest ntpd resident set size.
5211 */
5212 DPRINTF(2, ("ntp_rlimit: MEMLOCK: %d %s\n",
5213 (int)(rl_value / rl_scale), rl_sstr));
5214 rl.rlim_cur = rl.rlim_max = rl_value;
5215 if (setrlimit(RLIMIT_MEMLOCK, &rl) == -1)
5216 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "Cannot set RLIMIT_MEMLOCK: %m");
5217 break;
5218# endif /* RLIMIT_MEMLOCK */
5219
5220# ifdef RLIMIT_NOFILE
5221 case RLIMIT_NOFILE:
5222 /*
5223 * For large systems the default file descriptor limit may
5224 * not be enough.
5225 */
5226 DPRINTF(2, ("ntp_rlimit: NOFILE: %d %s\n",
5227 (int)(rl_value / rl_scale), rl_sstr));
5228 rl.rlim_cur = rl.rlim_max = rl_value;
5229 if (setrlimit(RLIMIT_NOFILE, &rl) == -1)
5230 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "Cannot set RLIMIT_NOFILE: %m");
5231 break;
5232# endif /* RLIMIT_NOFILE */
5233
5234# ifdef RLIMIT_STACK
5235 case RLIMIT_STACK:
5236 /*
5237 * Provide a way to set the stack limit to something
5238 * smaller, so that we don't lock a lot of unused
5239 * stack memory.
5240 */
5241 DPRINTF(2, ("ntp_rlimit: STACK: %d %s pages\n",
5242 (int)(rl_value / rl_scale), rl_sstr));
5243 if (-1 == getrlimit(RLIMIT_STACK, &rl)) {
5244 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "getrlimit(RLIMIT_STACK) failed: %m");
5245 } else {
5246 if (rl_value > rl.rlim_max) {
5247 msyslog(LOG_WARNING,
5248 "ntp_rlimit: using maximum allowed stack limit %lu instead of %lu.",
5249 (u_long)rl.rlim_max,
5250 (u_long)rl_value);
5251 rl_value = rl.rlim_max;
5252 }
5253 rl.rlim_cur = rl_value;
5254 if (-1 == setrlimit(RLIMIT_STACK, &rl)) {
5255 msyslog(LOG_DEBUG,
5256 "ntp_rlimit: Cannot set RLIMIT_STACK: %m");
5257 }
5258 }
5259 break;
5260# endif /* RLIMIT_STACK */
5261
5262 default:
5263 fatal_error("ntp_rlimit: unexpected RLIMIT case: %d", rl_what);
5264 }
5265}
5266#endif /* HAVE_SETRLIMIT */

5268
5269char *
5270build_iflags(u_int32 iflags)
5271{
5272 static char ifs[1024];
5273
5274 ifs[0] = '\0';
5275
5276 if (iflags & INT_UP) {
5277 iflags &= ~INT_UP;
5278 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "up");
5279 }
5280
5281 if (iflags & INT_PPP) {
5282 iflags &= ~INT_PPP;
5283 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "ppp");
5284 }
5285
5286 if (iflags & INT_LOOPBACK) {
5287 iflags &= ~INT_LOOPBACK;
5288 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "loopback");
5289 }
5290
5291 if (iflags & INT_BROADCAST) {
5292 iflags &= ~INT_BROADCAST;
5293 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "broadcast");
5294 }
5295
5296 if (iflags & INT_MULTICAST) {
5297 iflags &= ~INT_MULTICAST;
5298 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "multicast");
5299 }
5300
5301 if (iflags & INT_BCASTOPEN) {
5302 iflags &= ~INT_BCASTOPEN;
5303 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "bcastopen");
5304 }
5305
5306 if (iflags & INT_MCASTOPEN) {
5307 iflags &= ~INT_MCASTOPEN;
5308 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "mcastopen");
5309 }
5310
5311 if (iflags & INT_WILDCARD) {
5312 iflags &= ~INT_WILDCARD;
5313 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "wildcard");
5314 }
5315
5316 if (iflags & INT_MCASTIF) {
5317 iflags &= ~INT_MCASTIF;
5318 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "MCASTif");
5319 }
5320
5321 if (iflags & INT_PRIVACY) {
5322 iflags &= ~INT_PRIVACY;
5323 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "IPv6privacy");
5324 }
5325
5326 if (iflags & INT_BCASTXMIT) {
5327 iflags &= ~INT_BCASTXMIT;
5328 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, "bcastxmit");
5329 }
5330
5331 if (iflags) {
5332 char string[10];
5333
5334 snprintf(string, sizeof string, "%0x", iflags);
5335 appendstr(ifs, sizeof ifs, string);
5336 }
5337
5338 return ifs;
5339}

5439 appendstr(rfs, sizeof rfs, "notrap");
5440 }
5441
5442 if (rflags & RES_DONTTRUST) {
5443 rflags &= ~RES_DONTTRUST;
5444 appendstr(rfs, sizeof rfs, "notrust");
5445 }
5446
5447 if (rflags & RES_VERSION) {
5448 rflags &= ~RES_VERSION;
5449 appendstr(rfs, sizeof rfs, "version");
5450 }
5451
5452 if (rflags) {
5453 char string[10];
5454
5455 snprintf(string, sizeof string, "%0x", rflags);
5456 appendstr(rfs, sizeof rfs, string);
5457 }
5458
5459 if ('\0' == rfs[0]) {
5460 appendstr(rfs, sizeof rfs, "(none)");
5461 }
5462
5463 return rfs;
5464}
5465
5466
5467static void
5468appendstr(
5469 char *string,
5470 size_t s,
5471 const char *new
5472 )
5473{
5474 if (*string != '\0') {
5475 (void)strlcat(string, ",", s);
5476 }
5477 (void)strlcat(string, new, s);
5478
5479 return;
5480}
